string.text: Thank you... err... Marked One, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that... Could I be of additional help to you?
I'm looking for laboratory X16. The Barman told me you might be informed about its location.

We've long had an interest in laboratory X16...or, rather, in the mechanism inside it that emits radiation which directly affects people's consiousness. I'm afraid I have to disappoint you: the place is impossible to penetrate without special PSI-armour. The outcome is known in advance - even if you could evade the swarms of zombies that infest the laboratory entrance, you run the risk of becoming one of them. This is all very serious. However, we've designed a screening device to help shield the radiation, but to fine-tune it we have to obtain additional measurements. If you help us with this task, we could probably provide you with a fully calibrated prototype for field testing.
Measurements?

If you, together with our associate, take all the necessary measurements, I will prepare a fully workable prototype of the armour and will give it to you. It will most likely let you get inside the laboratory.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Kruglov and start on your way. He is already equipped with everything necessary.
OK.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Semenov and start on your way. He's got everything you will need.
OK.
No.. right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.
Yes, sir? What might you be looking for?
I'm looking for laboratory X16. The Barman told me you might be informed about its location.
Thank you, Marked One, for rescuing Kruglov. Take this full-pressure suit as a reward for your troubles. Also, I suspect you didn't come here for a simple reward, am I right?
I'm looking for laboratory X16. The Barman told me that you might be informed about its location.

We have long studied the radiation from laboratory X16, and you won’t break into it without special armour. We've designed a PSI-protection device to help shield the radiation, but we need to take some more measurements to fine-tune it. If you help us take these measurements, I will give you a calibrated prototype that will allow you to get inside the laboratory. Do you agree?
OK.
Excellent, talk to Kruglov and start on your way. He's got everything necessary.
No, I'm not up for this yet.
That's a real pity. So far we've been unable to send a measurement expedition of our own.
Yes, sir? What might you be looking for?

We've long had an interest in laboratory X16...or, rather, in the mechanism inside it that emits radiation which directly affects people's consiousness. I'm afraid I have to disappoint you: the place is impossible to penetrate without special PSI-armour. The outcome is known in advance - even if you could evade the swarms of zombies that infest the laboratory entrance, you run the risk of becoming one of them. This is all very serious. However, we've designed a screening device to help shield the radiation, but to fine-tune it we have to obtain additional measurements. If you help us with this task, we could probably provide you with a fully calibrated prototype for field testing.
Go on.

If you, together with our associate, take all the necessary measurements, I will prepare a fully workable prototype of the armour and will give it to you. It will most likely let you get inside the laboratory.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Kruglov and start on your way. He is already equipped with everything necessary.
OK.
OK, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Semenov and start on your way. He's got everything you will need.
OK.
You don't understand, there's radiation. No one has been able to come closer than half a kilometre - it makes a zombie out of anyone. Going there without an armour is just like suicide, get it?
Hrm. That changes things.
To hell with it, just tell me all you know.

OK, but don't say I didn't warn you. Vasiliev worked on the laboratory problem. About a week ago he and stalker by the name of Ghost attempted to get inside the laboratory. After several hours we felt a shake and radiation stopped; after one more hour we got a signal from Vasiliev, it was coming from the swamp but then vanished. By the looks of things, Vasiliev is gone. Try to find his body: he had accurate information about the laboratory - where it is and how to get in. He might have also known how to turn off the radiation. The laboratory entrance is most likely to be hidden in the basement of one of the buildings based on plant territory.
Âîò è îòëè÷íî.
No.. right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.

Thank you... mmm... Marked One, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that…

You did a splendid job, Marked One! Now that the radiation is turned off, we will be able to order new expeditions and explore previously inaccessible territories. And also... from now on we will conduct a most favourable pricing policy toward you.
Thank you.
Yes, Marked One? What are you looking for?
You managed superbly! Listen, if the results you obtained are correct, the prototype can actually provide effective protection for you against the radiation from Õ16!
Glad to hear that.

Now your path to the laboratory is clear... except that if the source of radiation isn't destroyed and doesn't lose its power, you may not have enough time to get back. So, my dear sir, here is the deal. Our calculations have produces an estimated location of the radiation source as well as the fact that it is under ground. With your permission, I have already marked the spot on your map.
How exactly does one get inside the laboratory X16? Where is the entrance located?

The X16 problem was being studied by Vasiliev... About a week ago he, together with a colleague of yours – his name, I think, was Ghost – attempted to get inside the laboratory. After some time an anomalous emission occurred. We felt a bad shake and the singal vanished. In an hour we registered it again – it was coming from the direction of the swamps, but then died out... it seems that Vasiliev's life ended at the same time. If only we could find the body! Vasiliev was carrying dependable recording equipment that had to have registered accurate data on X16. And they surely could have found some important evidence. Perhaps that would help explain how to turn off the radiation. I have already written down for you all the co-ordinates known to me.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body – that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the laboratory's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try.
Why did he die? Weren't you supposed to protect him?!
Kruglov got shot by the zombies… I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
But how, how could it happen?! Damn it, hell, everything is going haywire! I'll have to write up another report of the circumstances of his death, then request new workers… when will this stop!..
Listen... Kruglov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X16.

OK. Let's try to save the situation. Here is the prototype, but be careful, it's not calibrated properly... well, you already know why. So, stalker, even before you come to the radiation source, you must hurry.
How does one get inside the laboratory X16? Where exactly is the entrance located?

The X16 problem was being studied by Vasiliev... About a week ago he, together with a colleague of yours – his name, I think, was Ghost – attempted to get inside the laboratory. After some time an anomalous emission occurred. We felt a bad shake and the singal vanished. In an hour we registered it again – it was coming from the direction of the swamps, but then died out... it seems that Vasiliev's life ended at the same time. If only we could find the body! Vasiliev had dependable recording equipment that had to have registered accurate data on X16. And they surely could have found some important evidence. Perhaps that would explain how to turn off the radiation. I have already written down for you all the co-ordinates known to me.
Anything else?

You must start by finding Vasiliev's body – that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the laboratory's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. If he has survived somehow... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try.
Why did he die? Weren't you supposed to protect him?!
Semenov got shot by the zombies… I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
But how, how could it happen?! Damn it, hell, everything is going haywire! I'll have to write up another report of the circumstances of his death, then request new workers… when will this stop!..
Listen... Semenov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X16.

OK. Let's try to save the situation. Here is the prototype, but be careful, it's not calibrated properly... well, you already know why. So, stalker, even before you come to the radiation source, you must hurry.
How does one get inside the laboratory X16? Where exactly is the entrance located?

The X16 problem was being studied by Vasiliev... About a week ago he, together with a colleague of yours – his name, I think, was Ghost – attempted to get inside the laboratory. After some time an anomalous emission occurred. We felt a bad shake and the singal vanished. In an hour we registered it again – it was coming from the direction of the swamps, but then died out... it seems that Vasiliev's life ended at the same time. If only we could find the body! Vasiliev was carrying dependable recording equipment that had to have registered accurate data on X16. And they surely could have found some important evidence. Perhaps that would help explain how to turn off the radiation. I have already written down for you all the co-ordinates known to me.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body – that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the laboratory's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try.
Yes, Marked One?
Yes, Marked One?
It's too bad that Kruglov died... Alas, nothing can bring him back. It's most important that you bring us the measurement data. Did you?
Yes, here it is.
Ok, let me adjust the prototype. Wait for me here.
Gotcha.
No.
Then get them, and quick! I cannot calibrate the prototype properly without them.
Here is the prototype. If the measurement data is correct, it will provide effective protection for you against the radiation.
Can you be a little clearer?

Now you can safely move around the laboratory. But remember: in case the radiation emitter isn't neutralised after a long while, the power of PSI-protection can fall below critical point. Our calculations produced an estimated location of the emitter, and we also know it's under ground. I've already marked it on your map.
How do I get inside X16? Where exactly is the entrance?

The X16 problem was being studied by Vasiliev... About a week ago he, together with a colleague of yours – his name, I think, was Ghost – attempted to get inside the laboratory. After some time an anomalous emission occurred. We felt a bad shake and the singal vanished. In an hour we registered it again – it was coming from the direction of the swamps, but then died out... it seems that Vasiliev's life ended at the same time. If only we could find the body! Vasiliev was carrying dependable recording equipment that had to have registered accurate data on X16. And they surely could have found some important evidence. Perhaps that would help explain how to turn off the radiation. I have already written down for you all the co-ordinates known to me.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body – that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the laboratory's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
OK, I'll try.
There's no time...
Yes, Marked One?
Professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.

Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly – just make sure not to let those cadavers too close to you. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again…
OK.
Wow! Marked One here on a personal visit! Finally you've made it to our parts. Talk to the Professor – he wants to thank you for rescuing me.
Later, later!
Hey, Marked One! How are things going?
Yes, Marked One?
Professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.

Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly – just make sure not to let those cadavers too close to you. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again…
OK.
I'm sorry, I have no time for this right now.
Hey, Marked One! How's life?
Wait a little bit... We need to finish talking.
Wait! I'm not donó taking measurements!
Yipe!.... Ouch... argh..
You alive? C'mon, get up... Get up slowly. It's all over. It's behind us now.
Hey, Marked One. How are you?
Done! Pack the camera, time to get leaving!
Hey, Marked One! How's life?
